Yes, there have been several recent technological advancements in the shipping industry that could address the potential drawbacks of relying on the Elbe River for transportation. 

For example, there is growing interest and investment in alternative fuels such as hydrogen and LNG (liquefied natural gas) to power ships, which could significantly reduce emissions and pollution. Some ships are also being equipped with exhaust scrubbers or being modified to operate on electric power.

Digital technologies such as automated systems, sensors, and artificial intelligence are also being developed and implemented to optimize shipping operations and reduce fuel consumption. For example, ship routing and scheduling algorithms that leverage real-time data on weather, water levels, and traffic to calculate the most efficient routes and speeds.

In addition, there are innovations in ship design such as using more lightweight materials and changing the shape of ships to reduce drag and improve fuel efficiency.

Overall, these technological advancements in the shipping industry have the potential to significantly mitigate the environmental risks and other potential drawbacks of relying on the Elbe River for transportation.
